content: should produce a msk that is about 1 5 times as long as the esk abbreviations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet esk edge solomon s knot msk main solomon s knot scarf row 1 chain 2 single_crochet into 2nd chain from hook 10 esk or any multiple of 2 esk to reach desired width turn row 2 1 msk single_crochet into single_crochet between 3rd and 4th loop from hook * 2 msk skip 2 esk loops single_crochet into next single_crochet repeat from * to end turn row 3 2 esk 1 msk single_crochet into single_crochet between 4th and 5th loop from hook * 2 msk skip 2 msk loops single_crochet into next single_crochet repeat from * to end turn repeat row 3 until you reach required length final row 2 esk single_crochet into single_crochet between 3rd and 4th loop from hook * 2 esk skip 2 msk loops single_crochet into next single_crochet repeat from * to end fasten_off yarn lllooovvveee kkknnnooottt ssscccaaarrrfff chain esk single_crochet msk special stitches solomon s knot skip for lefties 1 start with a loop 3 insert the hook on the hook as you under the single would for any other back thread yarn stitch lengthen the over and draw loop as required through 1 loop 2 yarn over and 4 yarn over and draw through loop draw through both on hook keeping the loops on hook single back thread of the original long loop separate from the 2 front threads
